docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: More than a year after it was conceived, the largest and most important clinical trial of an AIDS drug in the United States is lagging, with only half the needed patients enrolled.

headline.main: Trial of AIDS Drug in U.S. Lags As Too Few Participants Enroll

docs.snippet: LEAD: More than a year after it was conceived, the largest and most important clinical trial of an AIDS drug in the United States is lagging, with only half the needed patients enrolled.

byline.original: By PHILIP M. BOFFEY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For 15 years the Rev. Gino Rigoldi has been trying to convince young heroin addicts that they can change their lives, a task now made considerably more difficult by the AIDS epidemic.

headline.main: Italy's Heroin Addicts Face New Challenge: AIDS

docs.snippet: LEAD: For 15 years the Rev. Gino Rigoldi has been trying to convince young heroin addicts that they can change their lives, a task now made considerably more difficult by the AIDS epidemic.

byline.original: By ROBERTO SURO, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Bernadette McLaughlin lives on the east side of this city, Margaret Puryear on the west. The two women share a deep nostalgia about a lost past and fears about the future. But they inhabit separate worlds, divided by far more than the Saw Mill River Parkway, the concrete barrier that runs between them.

headline.main: Yonkers Anguish: Black and White in 2 Worlds
